characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
characters.name: Kazuma Asogi
characters.description1: A certified lawyer and my best friend. He was on his way to London for a study tour when he was taken from this world.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
characters.name: Susato Mikotoba
characters.description1: A judicial assistant who was travelling with Kazuma to London for a study tour. She is the epitome of a refined Japanese lady.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
characters.name: Herlock Sholmes
characters.description1: There's not a person in the world who hasn't heard of this famous 'great detective'. Not a person except me, apparently.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
characters.name: Satoru Hosonaga
characters.description1: A chief inspector in the Imperial Police Bureau who's on an undercover mission, posing as a member of the ship's crew.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
characters.name: Bif Strogenov
characters.description1: A real wall of a man and a senior member of the Russian crew who's in charge of security around the first-class cabins.

characters.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
characters.name: Grimesby Roylott → Nikolina Pavlova
characters.description1: An older Russian gentleman travelling on the ship. He's staying in the first-class cabin next to Kazuma's.
characters.description2: A young ballerina who's fled her homeland of Russia to escape the Novavich Ballet.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: University Collar Pin
evidences.description1: Proof that I'm a student at the Imperial Yumei University. I always wear it on the collar of my uniform jacket.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Paper Seal
evidences.description1: Kazuma would stick this over the doors of the wardrobe for me. It says 'Keep out' in Japanese, though I'm not sure the Russian crew can actually read it.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: The Russian word for 'wardrobe' in purple ink. It would appear to have been written in the victim's final moments.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Article About Revolutionary
evidences.description1: An article on the front page of a Russian newspaper. The headline reads: 'Revolutionary Vilen Borshevik Flees Russia via Shanghai'.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Article About Ballerina
evidences.description1: An article on the back page of a Russian newspaper. The headline reads: 'Renowned Prima Ballerina of the Novavich Ballet Disappears from Shanghai!'

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Kazuma's Diary
evidences.description1: A diary Kazuma was keeping of his trip to London. According to the last entry he made before his death, he spied what appeared to be a 'speckled band'.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Post-Mortem Report
evidences.description1: A report from the SS Burya's medical officer, giving the cause of death as a cervical spine injury. There were no traces of external injury or poison.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Mark on Floor
evidences.description1: A piece of a small glass object and what looks like a scuff mark made by Kazuma's shoes were found by the victim's body.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Ship's Log
evidences.description1: A record kept by the crew assigned to the first-class cabin area. There are virtually no entries from 2 a.m. until early this morning.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Unbreakable Speckled Band
evidences.name: Pavlova & Darka Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph of Miss Pavlova and her 'friend' - a kitten named Darka. The tiara she would wear on stage can also be seen.
